message: An OSCAL SAR must have an import-ap element.
An OSCAL SAR import-ap element must have an href attribute.

An OSCAL SAR import-ap element href attribute which is document-relative must identify a target within
                the document. .
An OSCAL SAR import-ap element must reference an available SAP document.

An OSCAL SAR import-ap element must reference an available SAP document that has an import-ssp element that
                references an available SSP document.

An OSCAL SAR import-ap element must reference an available SAP document that has an import-ssp element that
                references an available SSP document that has a import-profile element that references a resolved profile catalog
                document.

An OSCAL SAR import-ap element href attribute which is an external reference must identify an available
                target.

An OSCAL SAR which does not directly import the SAP must declare the SAP as a back-matter
                resource.

Resources of type 'evidence' or 'artifact' must have a matching relevant-evidence or subject
                UUID.

An observation of type 'evidence' or 'artifact' must have at least one rlink and/or base64
                element.

If an observation of type 'evidence' or 'artifact' has an rlink the @href value must be
                a relative path.

An OSCAL SAR with a SAP resource declaration must have one and only one
                rlink element.

An OSCAL SAR SAP rlink must have a 'text/xml' or 'application/json'
                media-type.

All in scope controls in the resolved baseline profile must have objectives that match a
                finding/target/@target-id in the current result assembly.
There must exist an attestation with a part containing a property with a name of 'recommend-authorization'.

Within a SAR, every unsatisfied PL-2 objective must have a matching resolved baseline profile catalog
                part.

Every
                result must contain no more than one unsatisfied finding for the control PL-2.
A finding must have an actor who is described in a SAP or SAR party assembly.

A historic observation must have an actor that is described in either the SAP or the SAR party
                assemblies.

The actor @type must have one of the following as string content: 'tool', 'party', or
                'assessment-platform'.
A target of objective-id type must have a property of 'implementation-status'.
The target's implementation-status property must be properly identified.
A target of objective-id type must have a status.
The target's status element must be properly identified.

Every finding target must be unique
                within a result.

A subject uuid within an observation of type 'control-objective' must have a matching party @uuid in the
                metadata.

A subject element type attribute must contain one of the following as string content: 'component',
                'inventory-item', 'location', 'party', or 'user'.

A subject uuid within an observation of type 'control-objective' must have a matching resource @uuid
                in the back-matter.
A method element must contain one of the following strings: 'EXAMINE', 'INTERVIEW', or 'TEST'.
A related-task element's uuid attribute must match a task @uuid value in the associated SAP.

An observation with a type of 'risk-adjustment' must have a @uuid that matches a
                finding/related-observation/@observation-uuid.

An observation with a type of 'operational-requirement' must have a @uuid that matches a
                finding/related-observation/@observation-uuid.

An observation with a type of 'risk-adjustment' must have a relevant-evidence/link/@href, whose value
                after the '#', matches a back-matter/resource/@uuid.

An observation with a type of 'operational-requirement' must have a relevant-evidence/@href, whose
                value after the '#', matches a back-matter/resource/@uuid.

An observation of type 'historic' must also have a method of
                'MIXED'.
An observation with a type of 'ssp-statement-issue' must also have a method of 'EXAMINE'.

An observation with a type of 'ssp-statement-issue' must have a matching
                finding/related-observation/@observation-uuid value.

The finding that has a related-observation/observation-uuid that matches an observation/@uuid, must also
                have a implementation-statement-uuid value that matches a statement/@uuid in the associated SSP.

An observation with a type of 'false-positive' must have a @uuid that matches a
                finding/related-observation/@observation-uuid.

An observation must have a relevant-evidence href that matches the penetration-test-report back-matter
                resource @uuid value.

A penetration test observation must have actors that are described in the responsible-party assemblies
                for 'penetration-test-lead' or 'penetration-test-team'.

A related-observation that has an @observation-uuid that matches an observation/@uuid with a type of
                'false-positive' must have an associated-risk/@risk-uuid that matches a risk/@uuid.

A risk with an @ns of 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and an @name of 'risk-adjustment' should have a
                matching statement in the associated SSP.

A risk with a status of 'closed' must have a risk-log/entry with a status-change of
                'closed'.
Risks with priority properties must have unique priority values.

A risk must have a response of lifecycle with a value of
                recommendation.

The recommend-authorization attestation with a non-yes value must have a first part with a first
                paragraph that matches the text in the Guide.
A finding with a target/status of 'not-satisfied must have an associated-risk element.
An associated-risk/@risk-uuid must have a matching risk/@uuid in the SAR.

Facets
                with @name of 'likelihood' and @name='impact' must exist in the characterization.

A facet with @name = 'likelihood' or @name='impact' must have an @value of either 'low', 'moderate',
                or 'high'.

An observation of actor type 'tool' must have a type of 'finding' and a method
                of 'TEST'.

An observation with an actor of type 'tool' must have a matching
                assessment-assets/component.

The observation UUID must be cited by (at least) one of the parent result's finding
                related observations.

This
                observation has a relevant-evidence href that references a raw-tool-output back-matter resource.

Each subject of an automated tool must correspond to one of the locally defined
                components or inventory-items.
All assessments should be completed.
Assessment start precedes assessment end.

The most recently completed assessment must have been completed within the last 12
                months.
Every observation within this most recent result is recently collected.

The
                count of party-uuid elements of a responsible-party of role-id 'penetration-test-lead' must be one.
